Taxing profits will actually encourage investment rather than short term bottom line thinking.

grizzly6626

I think most politicians are liars and crooks, in it for themselves. You and me dont matter to washington, we are nothing more than a readily available source of labor and money. Washington spends trillions helping other nations that hate us to begin with. With the exceptions of Europe and Israel, I wish our government would just tell the rest of the world to fend for themselves, and start using that money to help our country. OPEC gets a big chunk of their money from the US, and they got greedy, plain and simple. If we would quit buying their 100 dollar a barrell oil for a while, their pocket book will suffer a lot and maybe then they will price their oil at a reasonable fee. I know it would hurt here for a while if this happened, but in the long run we would benefit because gas would go down a lot. The gas companies here also need to be hit hard, because all of them are reporting record breaking profits by gauging us at the pumps, but then the gas companies turn around and say that most of those profits are going into research. The only place those profits are really going is in someones pocket. Sorry, I just discovered I am off topic. Anyhow back to the topic, I think we should just vote out everyone in washington who is not in it for us, and put all new people in office, and if those new people dont work for the people of America, we vote them right back out. Eventually politicians will get the message.
isly ilwott

I know the right has been claiming he does. I haven't seen any policy of his that actually advocates it.
 
 ..... 
Try the so-called "windfall profits tax" on the "big oil companies". He wants to give each of us a thousand dollars...to be taken from the oil companies 'excessive' profits.
 
 He has no interest in reminding us that the profit margins for the oil companies are not huge. It's the volume of oil products that we consume with our great demand for three or four cars in every garage that makes the oil companies profits seem huge. It's that BIG number that we see posted as oil company profit that makes the redistribution seem fair to the welfare Democrats.
 
 Maybe he should consider a windfall profits tax on Hollywood every time they come up with a movie that makes 150 million in its first month in the theaters.
 
 How about a windfall profits tax on Nike for making so much money on their use of twenty cent labor to make their two hundred dollar sneakers?
 
 So far, he's only proposed the oil profits tax...along with Hillary.
 
 What they don't tell you is that if we tax profits enough, companies will stop trying so hard to make profits, investors will withhold exoansion capaital and profits will decrease to the point that jobs are lost and NOBODY BENEFITS. I wonder continually why this reality is so hard to grasp.
